Topic.Title: CA businesses to kiss off state

Message.Msg: I live in San Antonio, and this is already happening. I was listening to a hunting show on the radio a couple of weeks ago and the discussion was about new groups of enviro-freaks being formed by CA libtards that have moved here and trying to get bills passed to limit fishing and hunting in a bunch of places. They said it wasn't going to happen soon, but eventually enough of them would be here to start getting laws passed. Libtards screw up their own states and then move somewhere else and start the process again, same thing happened to Phoenix when I lived there in the late 80s...

Topic.Title: CA businesses to kiss off state

Message.Msg: Yeah I've heard of this. Over time I'm guessing they can pull it off. Moreover, I suppose there are enough libs to pull that off in every state they choose to effect w/o effecting the demographics of the state they're moving from. Probably enough in CA alone to effect that.

Topic.Title: Calif real estate off the charts??

Message.Msg: Oh, I guess you didn't make yourself clear. You were saying sales were rebounding when it was prices you meant. Prices and sales are two different things, you know. I don't live in Marin Cty, I used it as an example. My niece does live in Marin and coincidently she is a loan broker so I do have some first hand account of what the market is. You use Silicon Valley as a marker for all of Calif "off the charts".? duhhh! Anything else I want to discuss, yes, my cave sits on 5 acres in wine country with a hot tub and a view you won't find in flat, yuppie Silicon Valley.
